alert.note: Alert for Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 9:12AM CDT until March 26 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Bogue Chitto River Near Bush affecting St. Tammany Parish. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Bogue Chitto River At Franklinton affecting Washington Parish. For the Bogue Chitto River...including Tylertown, Franklinton, Bush...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bogue Chitto River At Franklinton. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The national guard armory and parish corrections facility will require flood protection measures as river front property will flood. Sand bagging is recommended * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.0 feet on 05/06/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
